explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Stable to heat (up to 150degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (water solubility: 2.64mg/L (20degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data))

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Cannot be classified though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on the substances with melting points of <55degC (melting point: 46degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,828mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >2,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation studies reported the LC50 values of >0.031mg/L and >0.67mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989, 2005)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In rabbit skin irritation tests, the treated animals exhibited the highest Draize score of 0.7 and were fully recovered after 24 hours (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In the available rabbit eye irritation tests, mild effects were noted immediately after instillation, but the effects cleared up by 24 hours (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro chromosome aberration tests, in vitro reverse mutation tests and mouse in vivo micronucleus tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989, 1991)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on parental reproduction and offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1989)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "piloerection," "tremors," "perspiration," "lacrimation," and "diarrhea" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1973)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In repeat dose toxicity studies in animals, increased organ weights and cholinesterase inhibition were noted, but no target organs were identified from these findings (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1991)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.62microg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 1992).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=4.31 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.
